Label: You have been automatically entered into the 'express financial remedy procedure' pilot. This is because you have noted that you and the respondent's estimated total combined net assets are £250,000 or less, and your case has been allocated to one of the participating courts. You can find out more information on the pilot procedure here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/what-to-expect-if-you-are-in-the-express-financial-remedy-pilot/, this will open a new tab.

The pilot aims to reduce the time taken to resolve contested financial remedy cases where the parties' estimated total combined net assets are £250,000 or less. This application has automatically entered into the pilot because you have noted the parties' estimated total combined net assets are £250,000 or less; and the case has been allocated to one of the participating courts. The term estimated 'total combined net assets' refers to the combined value of the applicant's and the respondent's assets (excluding pension rights or Pension Protection Fund compensation entitlement) after the deduction of liabilities and mortgages. You can find out more information on the pilot which includes changes to filing and listing times here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/what-to-expect-if-you-are-in-the-express-financial-remedy-pilot/, this will open a new tab.

**Your application will no longer be entered in the Express Financial Remedy Pilot.**

To be entered into the pilot the parties' estimated total combined net assets have to be £250,000 or less; and the case has to be allocated to one of the participating courts.

Any Fast Track case or a Variation application will not meet the requirements of the pilot.

Your application will no longer be entered into the pilot as answers have been updated that cause the application to no longer meet the pilot requirements.
